article.description: Behind Kelly Whitney's 24 points, the Pirates rally late in second half to earn second-round shot at Duke
article.headline: Whitney's 24 lead Pirates to comeback win
article.linkText: Seton Hall comeback ends Duke-Arizona talk

inlines.body:
Dick Vitale's Tourney Take
It's only fitting that an underachiever like Arizona was sent packing in the first round. The Pirates deserve tons of credit. Coach Louis Orr has done a super job, and senior guard Andre Barrett should be playing at the next level next season. He's a terrific veteran leader who knows how to distribute the rock. Big man Kelly Whitney really impressed me inside with his double-double (24 points, 14 boards) before leaving the game with what appeared to be leg cramps. For those who thought Duke-Arizona would be a great second-round matchup, guess what -- the Pirates are there, not the Wildcats.
More on Thursday's Games

article.story: TUCSON, Ariz. (AP) -- Channing Frye scored 24 points and Mustafa Shakur added 22 points and 10 rebounds to lead No. 10 Arizona to a 105-80 exhibition victory over Sonoma State on Thursday night. Frye had 13 points in the Wildcats' 17-6 run to open the second half that made it 69-47 with 15:54 remaining. Sonoma State was within 51-41 at halftime by shooting 48 percent from the field. But Frye scored the first nine points of the second half with a dunk, two short jumpers and a three-point play. Hassan Adams finished with 19 points for Arizona while Ivan Radenovic had 18. Ryan Hensel scored 13 points for Sonoma State and Vince Inglima had 12.
